intro: Bulbostylis zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are typically borne on short stalks. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
